title: Introduction to Rocket Propulsion
description: This assignment covers the fundamental principles of rocket propulsion, including Newton's laws applied to rocketry, thrust equations, and basic engine types. Students will analyze historical rocket designs and calculate performance metrics.

title: Fuel and Combustion
description: Analyze different types of rocket fuels and their combustion processes. Students will study chemical reactions, energy release, and efficiency calculations for solid and liquid propellants.

title: Nozzle Design
description: Design an optimized rocket nozzle considering expansion ratio, throat diameter, and exit conditions. Apply compressible flow theory and calculate specific impulse improvements.

title: Fundamentals of Aerodynamics
description: Explore basic aerodynamic principles including Bernoulli's equation, pressure distribution, and lift generation. Analyze airfoil characteristics and boundary layer theory.

title: Subsonic and Supersonic Flow
description: Compare and contrast subsonic and supersonic flow regimes. Study shock waves, Mach numbers, and compressibility effects on aerodynamic performance.

title: Aerodynamic Heating
description: Calculate aerodynamic heating during atmospheric entry and design thermal protection systems. Analyze heat transfer mechanisms and material selection criteria.

title: Spacecraft Structural Design
description: Design spacecraft structures to withstand launch loads, space environment, and operational stresses. Perform finite element analysis and material selection for optimal strength-to-weight ratios.

title: Orbital Mechanics
description: Calculate orbital parameters, transfer orbits, and mission trajectories. Apply Kepler's laws and solve Lambert's problem for interplanetary missions.

title: Spacecraft Systems Engineering
description: Integrate spacecraft subsystems including power, thermal control, communications, and attitude control. Develop system-level requirements and perform trade studies.

title: Introduction to Organic Chemistry
description: Master IUPAC nomenclature and identify functional groups in organic molecules. Draw structural formulas and understand isomerism and stereochemistry basics.

title: Functional Groups and Reactions
description: Study characteristic reactions of major functional groups including alcohols, carbonyls, and carboxylic acids. Predict products and mechanisms for organic transformations.

title: Organic Synthesis
description: Plan multi-step synthetic routes using retrosynthetic analysis. Execute synthesis of target molecules and purify products using chromatographic techniques.

title: Coordination Chemistry
description: Investigate the structure and bonding of coordination complexes. Apply crystal field theory to predict magnetic properties and electronic spectra of transition metal complexes.

title: Bonding Theories
description: Compare valence bond theory, molecular orbital theory, and ligand field theory. Use group theory to analyze molecular symmetry and spectroscopic selection rules.

title: Inorganic Materials
description: Explore applications of inorganic chemistry in materials science including catalysts, semiconductors, and nanomaterials. Synthesize and characterize inorganic compounds.

title: Thermodynamics
description: Apply the laws of thermodynamics to chemical systems. Calculate enthalpy, entropy, and Gibbs free energy changes to predict reaction spontaneity and equilibrium.

title: Chemical Kinetics
description: Determine rate laws from experimental data and propose reaction mechanisms. Study catalysis, enzyme kinetics, and factors affecting reaction rates.

title: Quantum Chemistry
description: Apply quantum mechanical principles to chemical systems. Solve the Schr√∂dinger equation for simple systems and understand atomic orbital shapes and molecular bonding.

title: Elvish Languages
description: Translate passages from Sindarin and Quenya texts. Master Tengwar script and understand the linguistic evolution of Elvish languages throughout the Ages.

title: Dwarvish and Khuzdul
description: Study the secret language of the Dwarves and decipher Cirth runes. Analyze inscriptions from Moria and Erebor to understand Dwarvish culture and history.

title: Black Speech and Other Tongues
description: Examine the Black Speech of Mordor and other lesser-known languages of Middle-earth. Understand the linguistic influence of evil on language development.

title: Historical Alliances
description: Analyze the Last Alliance of Elves and Men and other historic partnerships. Examine the diplomatic factors that led to successful cooperation between different races.

title: Conflict Resolution
description: Study diplomatic negotiation techniques used by Wizards and leaders in Middle-earth. Propose solutions to historical conflicts considering cultural sensitivities.

title: The Council of Elrond
description: Analyze the decision-making process at the Council of Elrond. Evaluate leadership principles and consensus-building strategies used during the War of the Ring.

title: React Fundamentals
description: Build functional React components using JSX syntax. Implement props and state management to create interactive user interfaces with proper component hierarchy.

title: React Hooks and State Management
description: Implement useState, useEffect, and custom hooks in React applications. Manage complex state using Context API and understand component lifecycle optimization.

title: React and REST APIs
description: Integrate React applications with RESTful APIs. Handle asynchronous operations, implement error handling, and manage loading states for optimal user experience.

title: Angular Fundamentals
description: Create Angular applications using TypeScript and Angular CLI. Understand modules, components, and services architecture for enterprise-scale applications.

title: Components and Data Binding
description: Master Angular template syntax and implement two-way data binding. Use directives and pipes to create dynamic, data-driven user interfaces.

title: Angular Services and Routing
description: Implement dependency injection and create reusable services. Configure Angular Router for navigation and implement route guards for authentication.

title: Vue Fundamentals
description: Build reactive Vue applications using the Vue instance and template syntax. Implement computed properties and watchers for efficient data management.

title: Vue Router and Vuex
description: Configure Vue Router for single-page applications. Implement centralized state management using Vuex with actions, mutations, and getters.

title: Vue Component Design
description: Design reusable Vue components using props, events, and slots. Apply Composition API patterns for better code organization and reusability.

title: C++ Basics
description: Write C++ programs using proper syntax, variables, and control structures. Implement functions and understand memory management fundamentals.

title: Object-Oriented Programming in C++
description: Design class hierarchies using inheritance and polymorphism. Implement virtual functions, operator overloading, and proper encapsulation practices.

title: STL and Templates
description: Utilize Standard Template Library containers and algorithms. Create generic functions and classes using templates for code reusability.

title: Python Basics
description: Write Python scripts using proper syntax and data types. Implement control flow, functions, and modules for organized code structure.

title: Data Structures in Python
description: Master Python data structures including lists, dictionaries, and sets. Use list comprehensions and generators for efficient data manipulation.

title: Python for Web Development
description: Build web applications using Flask framework. Create RESTful APIs and integrate with external services using Python libraries.

title: JavaScript Basics
description: Master JavaScript fundamentals including variables, data types, and functions. Understand scope, closures, and object manipulation techniques.

title: DOM Manipulation and Events
description: Select and modify DOM elements dynamically. Implement event listeners and handlers to create interactive web pages with user feedback.

title: Asynchronous JavaScript and ES6+
description: Implement promises and async/await for asynchronous operations. Use modern ES6+ features including arrow functions, destructuring, and modules.

title: Go Fundamentals
description: Write Go programs using proper syntax and idioms. Implement functions, packages, and error handling following Go best practices.

title: Concurrency in Go
description: Implement concurrent programs using goroutines and channels. Apply concurrency patterns for building scalable and efficient applications.

title: Building Web Services with Go
description: Create RESTful web services and HTTP servers using Go. Implement middleware, routing, and database integration for production-ready applications.
